featured.text: These seagoing mammals are among the lucky survivors of a whale-stranding last December at Cape Cod.
In contrast, the peacock is not 22 seen as lucky.
In places like India, the peacock is considered lucky because the great many “eyes” on its feathers are said to alert it to 23 evil.
A far less lucky 1 in 150 experiences high fever, tremors, paralysis, and coma.
However, even these people may look at the calendar to pick a lucky day when they make their choice.

definition.en_def: Having good fortune or favorable circumstances.
definition.example: She felt lucky to have such supportive friends.
